item.title: Postgres High Availability with CDC
item.description: Postgres High Availability can face challenges with Change Data Capture (CDC). The design of Postgresâ€™ replication introduces complexities that may stall failover. The primary system emits Write Ahead Logs (WAL) to standbys. However, if a CDC client lags, it can prevent effective failover, as the logical replication slot on the primary depends on the client’s progress.
